WorkItem.Description:
Title explains it.

Example output where block size is set to 16 bytes, but you get 16 instructions instead:
```
7F: $08D0 - $08DF:	6.665875%	5358366 tstates
  ld b,(hl)
  inc hl
  ld de,$8100
  push de
  ldir
  pop ix
  pop hl
  pop de
  pop bc
  call $48EB
  push af
  ld a,($82A2)
  bit 2,a
  jr z,$08D3
  ei
  pop af
```

While you're examining the profiler, it would also be neat if the "Cancel" button was wired up.
WorkItem.Summary: Profiler disassembly output shows <block size> instructions, not bytes
